+wai art I agree the actions of the "West" regarding the destruction of the

heroin trade must lay with those who produce heroin, who transport heroin 
and then sell heroin [especially the wholesalers]. These people are almost 
exclusively Muslim and I believe it is only when "all" Muslims acknowledge 
and stop [your post being a prime example] trying to evade responsibility 
for this crime will the world see real progress on this issue. P.S. the 
Taliban's order that no poppies be grown in 1992 was only issued to reduce 
the stockpiles of opium which were threatening to ruin the market. Proof 
that this was the case can be seen from the fact that throughout 1992 - 
1993 prices and supply, worldwide, remained stable.

comments.text:
Bottom line I don't see anything in Islam that I want. There is nothing 
Islam has to offer me that I don't already have, actually there's alot of 
thing that I would have to abandon if I switched to Islam. I won't have all 
power and all authority over heaven, nor will I have that connection with 
God that I so jealously guard. I would have to pick up things that I have 
no desire to pick up.

 I would have to oppress women, I couldn't love my wife in the way I want 
to love her, I would have to hide her from other men, that are to weak to 
control themselves. I would have to be a terrible husband, again which is 
something I'm not willing to do. I would have to pick up religious rituals 
like the way muslims pray, it's just weird. I couldn't have a conversation 
with God i'd be to busy making sure that i'm not bowing when I should be 
standing, and make sure i'm saying the right Arabic words, cause apparently 
allah can't speak any other language, and how would allah know what I want 
or need if I can't tell him. I'm sure he has gotten bored with the same 
exact prayer from everyone for a thousand years, no changes at all just the 
same old nothing. I would become the very thing that makes no sense to me. 
I'm not willing to do that, not now nor ever.

A billion plus people that God desperately want's to be in relationship 
with, and they can't see because their eyes are so filled with things that 
don't actually mean anything. It's never about what God did years and years 
ago, never! It's all about what God's doing now, today this very second. 
The generations before us set the stage for what God's doing today. And we 
are setting the stage for  what God's gonna be doing with the generations 
to come.

It breaks my heart seeing people and nations that can't see beyond what 
happen 900 years ago. It doesn't matter. Today matters.
comments.author: frontlinebassist777

comments.text:
+frontlinebassist777

"Within Islam I see oppressed women, you have to pray the same thing the 
same way 5 times a day. Its so ritualized that you guys even have body 
movements involved, just so weird. Then there's the really really big 
difference. Islam is called to convert or kill everyone, Christianity is 
called to love everyone. That's a pretty massive difference one that i'm 
not willing take on. Its just so much easier to love everyone and 
everything then to have to convert or kill it. Especially when you have a 
God that want's to be in relationship with and wants to love you. He loves 
to a degree that is beyond unimaginable. Islam for the most part hates more 
then it loves. I cannot be involved with something like that."

In Christianity there are oppressed women, depending on what version of 
Christianity or denomination you are considering. The people that listen to 
this guy are probably not oppressing their women. And ritual? What is that 
thing where we imagine ourselves to be eating the flesh and blood of Jesus 
if not a ritual? Gathering together in a church on certain days of the week 
is a ritual. Daily devotions is a ritual. You may say that you feel very 
alive when you do your rituals and those who follow other religious rituals 
are just going through the motions, but you can't say they don't feel as 
alive or more than you do. Surely there are some that just go through the 
motions as there are Christians who do this, but could there be Muslims who 
feel just as you do, but about Islam instead of Christianity? They don't 
think they have healing powers, but is it possible that they feel every bit 
as connected to God as you do? Might they feel the same overwhelming peace 
- if not more?

Islam is not called to kill everyone. Listen to this guy talk about the 
"kill them wherever you find them" verse. He explains it very well. If you 
don't want to let Muslims explain their Qur'an, perhaps you should be 
consistent and allow non-Christians to explain the Bible as well. Wouldn't 
you say that a non-Christian was "taking it out of context"?

Check out reddit.com/r/islam as well as some more of this guy's videos if 
you want a less western biased understanding of Islam. I used to be afraid 
of Muslims, but after learning a bit I've realized my information was wrong.
comments.author: Stephen Reed

comments.text:
Well you see with Jesus and the bible I have a relationship with God which 
means that I can, and do, talk to God on a daily basis. This action is 
highly encouraged, and out of that relationship I have all power and all 
authority under heaven, because I'm like totally best friends with God. 
Within Islam I don't see that type of connection. I see alot of ritual, 
basically a really massive list of do and don't. With Christianity you have 
the same kinda of thing, but the list is very much so smaller, and with 
being besties with God the list is just not of consequence because when I'm 
friends with God I have no desire to take part of the things on the "don't 
list" and I'm filled with desire to see the thing's on the "do" list take 
part in and through my life. It's this idea that we all hold, when you have 
a friend you want to please that friend, and in return that friend wants to 
please you back, because you both want to keep that relationship.

In christian circles we have this saying. "It's not about religion, it's 
about relationship". Religion is this concept of doing things to get on 
God's good side. Like in order for God to look favorably on me I have 
to..... (fill in the blank) With Jesus there isn't any of that, I can just 
come to him with anything an every little nothing, and He cares about it, 
He cares about me, and He cares about what I care about, because He loves 
me and wants to keep that relationship with me, and I want to keep that 
relationship with Him.

Within Islam I see oppressed women, you have to pray the same thing the 
same way 5 times a day. Its so ritualized that you guys even have body 
movements involved, just so weird. Then there's the really really big 
difference. Islam is called to convert or kill everyone, Christianity is 
called to love everyone. That's a pretty massive difference one that i'm 
not willing take on. Its just so much easier to love everyone and 
everything then to have to convert or kill it. Especially when you have a 
God that want's to be in relationship with and wants to love you. He loves 
to a degree that is beyond unimaginable. Islam for the most part hates more 
then it loves. I cannot be involved with something like that.

This person's limbs are going to get restored because of the love of God. I 
don't even know this person's name or life, but yet still I love this 
person enough to challenge the throne room of heaven on a constant basis to 
see this impossible thing come alive on this person's body. It's going to 
happen, I have felt confirmation from heaven. I have absolutely no doubts 
at all. Islam does not have that kind of power. I cannot go from having all 
power and authority under heaven to having this idea that God's so far away 
when He's right here next to me at all times.
comments.author: frontlinebassist777

comments.text:
You missed my point, friend. Saying that Jesus is God is heretical because 
the Holy Qur'an states, in no uncertain language, that Jesus was a prophet 
of God. To say that Jesus was God and to worship him as such is to commit 
idolatry. The Muslim is to love Jesus as a prophet of God, but not to 
commit idolatry by worshiping him.

Heresy is not saying one thing and doing the opposite. That's hypocrisy. 
Heresy is "any belief or theory that is strongly at variance with 
established beliefs". Since declaring Jesus to be God is heretical to 
Islam, when you come to a Muslim video and claim that Jesus was God then 
you are a heretic by definition. In a Christian setting you would not be a 
heretic, but a Muslim or a Mormon would be.

I'm not aware of any claim by Islam that its followers will be able to heal 
the sick. That's a belief of some Christian sects.

If you can heal the sick by the power of Jesus, and since a Christian 
belief includes the power of intercessory prayer, please begin praying that 
my acquaintance regenerates his limbs and digits. If this does not happen 
I'll know your deity is not real and that your religion is false. If you 
choose not to pray for this then I'll know that you don't actually believe 
what you claim to believe and therefore you are a false believer.
comments.author: Stephen Reed

comments.text:
+Syed Rehman I will state from TORAH Book of Genesis 18:1-8 importantly - 
 18:1   And the LORD appeared unto him in the plains of Mamre: and he sat 
in the tent door in the heat of the day;
18:2   And he lift up his eyes and looked, and, lo, three men stood by him: 
and when he saw them, he ran to meet them from the tent door, and bowed 
himself toward the ground,
18:3   And said, My LORD, if now I have found favour in thy sight, pass not 
away, I pray thee, from thy servant:
18:4   Let a little water, I pray you, be fetched, and wash your feet, and 
rest yourselves under the tree:
18:5   And I will fetch a morsel of bread, and comfort ye your hearts; 
after that ye shall pass on: for therefore are ye come to your servant. And 
they said, So do, as thou hast said.
18:6   And Abraham hastened into the tent unto Sarah, and said, Make ready 
quickly three measures of fine meal, knead it, and make cakes upon the 
hearth.
18:7   And Abraham ran unto the herd, and fetcht a calf tender and good, 
and gave it unto a young man; and he hasted to dress it.
18:8   And he took butter, and milk, and the calf which he had dressed, and 
set it before them; and he stood by them under the tree, and they did EAT.

captions.text: The Story of Robert Davila.
You know who that is?
No, you don't
Because I do...
3 months ago I gave a KHUTBA in Forthfort...
I haven't been to that masjeed for 4 or 5 years.
And they invited me for some reason and I went
And I gave Khutba there
My khutba was about duaa
An Egyptian fellow comes up to me
A young man comes up to me and afterwords he said
Allah fulfilled my dua today
And I said whats your dua
He said my dua was that Nouman Ali khan sould meet Robert Davila.
I was like...
Are you Robert Davila?
He said nope, I am not Robert Davila
Robert Davila is my friend
But I think Allah full filling my dua
I was like... fire away! I wanna know
Robert Davila is a young man, who lives in a town 40 minutes past forforth...
He was a farmer, young guy
And he was hit by some short of genetic disorder that kiked him later on in his life
And he became paralyzed from the neck down
And he was, he is actually, he lives in a Nursing home
Most people in that Nursing home are 90 years, 100 years, really really old people.
And then, his room, he is paralyzed necked on, he is only 30 something years old.
That is in the nursing home. okay
And he is been that nursing home for the last 10 years.
His family got a computer for him that voice activated, so he can give vocie command put the headphones on
